section.title: network: Collecting messages using the RFC3164 protocol (network() driver)
section.para: The network() source driver can receive syslog messages conforming to RFC3164 from the network using the TCP, TLS, and UDP networking protocols.
You can use the RLTP protocol as well. For details about the RLTP protocol, see .

By default, the network() driver binds to 0.0.0.0, meaning that it listens on every available IPV4 interface on the TCP/601 port. To limit accepted connections to only one interface, use the localip() parameter. To listen on IPv6 addresses, use the ip-protocol(6) option.
